snippet: On Roosevelt Island, in the middle of New York City, a battle for leadership is being waged over a small spot where precious few people have their own plots to grow vegetables and other plants.
abstract: Roosevelt Island Garden Club has become a place where intrigue surrounding the garden presidency has grown as abundant as the daffodils, organic vegetables and lazy cats that populate this speck of earth in the middle of New York City; April Ward became president of the club on a platform of reform; now, other members are in revolt over her decision to allow anyone interested to tend the border plots.
lead_paragraph: On Roosevelt Island, in the middle of New York City, a battle for leadership is being waged over a small spot where precious few people have their own plots to grow vegetables and other plants.

headline.seo: Turmoil at the Roosevelt Island Garden Club
headline.main: Dirt Flies at the Garden Club (Even Before Spring Planting)
headline.print_headline: Dirt Flies at the Garden Club (Even Before Spring Planting)
